intro: Echites pycnanthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved devil's backbone, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its narrow, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, dry seeds.
